resources.string: It's a happy day when the woman you've loved several lifetimes says yes to being yours. \n\nThe sky may fall down, but as for me, I am the happiest man on Aeternum - nay, in the world!
Greetings, intrepid adventurer! Have you perchance ambled up from the shore? What tidings do you bring? \n\nThe town of Prydwen anxiously awaits news of that colossal storm.

Welcome to Prydwen, founded during the reign of the High King, a legacy honored to this day! \n\nAh, a report from Watcher Reese? Thank you! Hm. So it was foul Corruption behind the storm? Very well. I will dispatch a Knight straightaway.

In his report, Watcher Reese acknowledges your heroism, in which case, you belong here - Prydwen has a strong tradition of heroes. \n\nOf course, we always welcome guests, and you've arrived at a most fortuitous occasion.
Fortuitous Times
Ser Payne Bennett has requested you to meet the Minister of Monarch's Bluffs in his office.
"What's so fortuitous?"
Why, we have just learned the True Heir to the throne is returning to the region! \n\nThis is a day we have been awaiting for centuries, and a sign of new hope even during these troublesome times.
“Where has the heir been?”
I could recount the legends for days, but I must dispatch someone to the shore now. \n\nThe Knight-Regent is indisposed, but Minister Lochnir runs day-to-day affairs in Prydwen.
Minister Lochnir has been managing affairs in this town longer than most of us have been here. \n\nHe's someone you simply must meet. Don't dally, now!

Well now, two new faces to Prydwen in one day - many a year since I've seen that. But these are special times. \n\nAfter centuries, the True Heir returns, and the royal bloodline will once again sit upon the throne.
"Who is the True Heir? "

Forgive me, I take it for granted all are aware. The heir is Ser Gawain himself, most gallant of the High King's knights. \n\nYou will have the honor to see his homecoming, and the return of Prydwen's glory after many dark years.
Talk to Minister Lochnir,\nof Monarch's Bluffs
Find Minister Lochnir in his office
Introduce yourself to Minister Lochnir
Prydwen is a town unlike any other in Aeternum. \n\nHere, we honor the traditions from the reign of the High King. I take personal interest in ensuring that.

Across the centuries, I've watched the light fade from Monarch's Bluffs in the absence of a true ruler. \n\nOf course, the Knight-Regent has done all she can, with my wise counsel. And now, our patience will soon be rewarded.
A Prydwen Tradition
Minister Lochnir has generously arranged a room for you at Demetrius Biton's inn. Check in and warm yourself by the fire.
"When does Ser Gawain arrive?"

Only a matter of days. I am personally attending to preparations even now, as is my duty. \n\nTradition is everything, wouldn't you say? One such custom I've established is that we offer our guests a complementary room at the inn.
“Thank you. I appreciate that.”

You'll find the inn quite hospitable. I hand-selected the innkeep a few decades ago. \n\nSo by all means, check in and have a warm meal by the fire. I must attend to other matters now, but we will speak again.
The hour of the True Heir's return approaches quickly, and I have much to do. \n\nYou are welcome at the inn.
I do hope you appreciate your good fortune. The future is very bright. \n\nWhen the True Heir assumes the throne, we will restore Prydwen's former glory.

Now there's a familiar face! About time you caught up. \n\nHere we find ourselves in a little village pulled straight from the Middle Ages. Is it me, or does nothing on this island make any sense at all?
"I have a lot of questions."

No doubt, for a place where everyone gets eternal life, you'd think it'd be more… calm, dull even. Not saying I'd like that, mind you. \n\nOne thing that is the same though is cold, hard coin. You have it or you don't, makes all the difference.
Check in at the inn\n and enjoy the hospitality of The Regent's Rise
Check in at the inn\n and enjoy your stay at The Regent's Rise
Strange island, strange little town, strange people. \n\nOut of everyone I've met, you're the only one I feel I can trust.
We're both a little light in the pocket, but I did sell that loot we collected, so there's your share. \n\nNever let it be said Grace O'Malley doesn't pay her debts.
With Good Grace
Grace O'Malley has given you the coin she owes you. Look for bargains at the Trading Post and store the excess at the Storage Shed.
"So what do we do now?"
Well, you got that coin I just gave you so I'd suggest you get to spending it. \n\nBuy yourself a new blade, some new boots, whatever suits your fancy.
"Is there a shop here?"

Aye, there's a trading post out there, livelier market than I would've expected. \n\nYou should check out the Trading Post yourself and if you need to stash anything, there's a Storage Shed too. Go on, I'll be here.

You're in a new town, and you have some coin now - I'd get to spending it or stashing it myself. \n\nCarrying it around town, you're just asking for someone to slip a hand in your pocket and steal it.

Look at you! Here just a few hours and you're already the most popular person in town. You had a caller while you were out. \n\nThat overly chipper knight from the town gate dropped by, says he wants to have a word with you.
Grace O'Malley's here!\nSpeak to her and find out if she has any new tales.
Visit the Prydwen Trading Post\nand check what's for sale
Visit the Prydwen Storage Shed\nand lighten your load

That Ser Payne and Minister Lochnir talk this place up like it's got a grand history and a bright future, but I'm not buying it. \n\nWord in the tavern is that Prydwen's overrun with people fleeing from trouble at the outlying farms.
Honor and Loss
Grace O'Malley has asked you to meet with Ser Payne, the friendly knight you met at the gate to Monarch's Bluffs.
"What kind of trouble?"

Sounds like some kinda plague - people turning on their friends and neighbors with cold murder in their eyes. \n\nUnlike those red-eyed bastards on the beach, these folks aren't possessed. Seems like they don't have any souls at all.
“The Watcher called them "The Lost".”

I didn't trust all the shite coming out of that Watcher's mouth, but maybe there was some truth to it. \n\nAsk Ser Payne about these soulless Lost outside town. Maybe get a more honest idea of what's happening here.
One of the blokes in the tavern told me Ser Payne's two hundred years old! \n\nIt's going to take me a while to get used to this place.
I heard this "True Heir" is traveling here by a ship along the coast. \n\nThinking he might not be needing it any more. Could be that ship's available for a new captain…
Did you meet with the Minister? \n\nHe will certainly get you started in your new life here in Prydwen!

Excellent to see you again! Perhaps Miss O'Malley can be trusted, after all. \n\nAs to you, however, the Watcher's report guarantees it. In fact, the Knight-Regent would like to discuss a rather… delicate situation, if you're willing.
"Is this about 'the Lost'?"
Oh? So you have heard the unfortunate news from outlying areas… \n\nI'm sorry to hear that. We try not to worry newcomers with such things, but we've even had some knights who've failed to report in.
"Sounds pretty serious."

Yes, well… I hope… I mean, I have the utmost confidence this will be cleared up before the heir arrives. \n\nI think the Knight-Regent simply wants to take precautions. Please, speak with her when you can.
Yes, I do hope all these reports regarding the Lost turn out to be exaggerated. \n\nIt simply wouldn't do to have the True Heir return to find we've allowed things to get so dire.
Come, you will find shelter in Prydwen, traveler. \n\nCare for the townspeople as you would your family, and you will always be welcome here.

Come in, and be welcome. I will never forget the way this island tested me when I first arrived. \n\nI strive to ensure we are patient with newcomers, and in these times, our customs are even more difficult to observe.
“I've felt very welcome here.”

That is good to hear. I believe Ser Payne represents us well, and the spirit of everything Prydwen stands for. \n\nHowever, with all the anticipation surrounding Ser Gawain's return, we risk letting our optimism turn into denial.
Talk to Knight Payne

For weeks now, we've heard horror stories from people fleeing the farms, grieving the loved ones that turned on them. \n\nBehind their words, I sense a suppressed longing to surrender their own souls to despair.
The Pride of Prydwen
Knight-Regent Jin Jae, knight in charge of Monarch's Bluffs, has asked you to help Allya Musa at Cynefin Mines.
"What have you done for them?"

We offer shelter, comfort, and we dispatched knights to secure the roads, but many never returned. \n\nMinister Lochnir counsels patience. He believes the royal bloodline will solve all problems. But I feel I must act.
"What can I do to help?"

The mines are the backbone of Prydwen, where many townspeople earn their livelihoods. I've had no reports in days. \n\nI simply ask you visit and confirm with Foreman Allya that all is well. Then report back to me, please.
Foreman Allya usually sends regular status reports. \n\nI hope all is well, but we need to be certain.
If there is indeed trouble at the mines, do what you can to help them. \n\nLet me know what comes of it.
Believe me when I say, you don’t want to go into the mine. \n\nEveryone's fallen Lost, and still no word from Prydwen.

Whoah, you. If you thought you were going to the mines, think again. \n\nIf you have loved ones in there, I don't know what to tell you. Most everyone's fallen Lost, and no support from Prydwen in sight.
“I came from the Knight-Regent."

Oh, so NOW she sends someone? And a stranger who's not even a knight? \n\nI've sent missive after missive to the Minister, and I think I said:"send every knight available!" Doesn't look like that's what's happening.
Check if Cynefin Mine is alright\nby asking Foreman Allya about it.

For a while, some of the miners were holding out, fighting back with their picks against the teeth and claws of their now-Withered friends. \n\nAt this point, it's probably a lost cause. I can't imagine that any of them are still standing.
It was startling to see some of my miners escaping with their souls intact.\n\nThe Knight-Regent may have sent help late, but I'm glad she sent you.
Crisis at the Mines
A worried Allya Musa wants you to rescue any surviving miners at Cynefin Mine.
"I can go in and search."
You're brave, I'll give you that. But we're not talking about a handful of Withered, we're talking about the whole damn mine. \n\nIf you go in there and find anyone, I'd get them out of there fast.
You may not be a knight, but you got courage. \n\nAnd if that translates into some of my miners getting out of there, I sure as hell won't complain.
I-I thought I'd never get out of here… thank you!
The mine's lost! Everyone is Withered! I'm getting out of here!
Look for Elias, he was trying to fight back… I'm making a run for it!
I won’t leave here, not till every last one of us is safe. The others depend on me. \n\nBut tell Geertie to keep a warm pot of soup going. I'll get out at some point!
Finally, a sign of hope! A brave warrior battling their way through the Withered. \n\nIt's beyond a relief to see you up here. Now maybe we can find a way to reclaim the mine.
“I'm just here to get you out."
And for that I'm mighty grateful, sure enough! \n\nBut I believe I may have found the source of this terrible curse. You've got to see for yourself!
Check if Elias Derit is alright\nat Hiraeth Peak
This whole thing started when we found a damn tablet deep in the mine. \n\nSomeone had tried to make it look like it was just unearthed, but I know the look of freshly cut stone, and it wasn't fresh.
A Most Mysterious Tablet
Elias Derit believes the strange magical tablet is causing the trouble at the mines. Destroy the tablet and the Lost Pirates who guard it.
“Someone planted the tablet?”

I'm sure of it! The damn thing was making some unearthly sound. Not a one of us would touch it. \n\nThe next day, we had Lost pirates jumping down from the rocks, and then everyone started falling Lost.
"You believe this tablet was cursed?"

Well I'm no sorcerer, but that tablet's what started all this, no doubt about it. \n\nWe need to destroy the damn thing… and maybe gather any fragments and take them back to Prydwen. There's smart people there.
"Alright. And then you'll leave?"

Sure enough! I'm not looking to linger here with pirates and Withered swarming all over. \n\nBreak that tablet and who knows? Maybe all those Lost will disperse. Either way, I'll go. You have my word.
You said you'd shatter that damn tablet, and I'll be holding you to it!
God's blood! I didn't think you could actually pull it off, but you did! \n\nThough it seems my hope of the Lost leaving the mine won't be happening anytime soon.
The tablet is desroyed!\nGive Miner Derit the good news.
A promise is a promise. You held up your end of the bargain, so it's my turn. \n\nI'll go, but I swear one thing - I'll be coming back to reclaim this place as soon as we get the Lost out.
Fragments of Truth
Elias Derit wants you to take back news of Hiraeth Peak to Knight-Regent Jin Jae at Prydwen.
"Alright. Ready when you are."

You did all the work, so I'll let you have the honor of bringing whatever remains of that tablet back to Prydwen. \n\nThere's sages and people of that sort who can make sense of them. Oh. Ask the Knight-Regent, she'll know.
"Where will you go?"

The Foreman's a stubborn one, and I'll wager she's still waiting at the mine's entrance. \n\nI'll go tell her there's none left to save, and then I'll see you in town. I'll even buy you a round at Geertie's!
A deal's a deal. \n\nYou said you'd take whatever's left of that tablet back to Prydwen. So get to it, then.
I sure hope Geertie's got a pot of turnip soup going back at the tavern. \n\nI haven't eaten in, oh I don't know... too long!
I'm glad to see you've returned safely. Not long after you departed, I finally heard the news. \n\nTell me though, is it as bad as they say? Surely some of the miners made it out?
"We rescued a few, but most are Lost."
I can't tell you how disappointed I am to hear that. I have failed in my duty to protect the people of Prydwen. \n\nThe warnings were there, and I allowed them to be ignored.
Inform Knight-Regent Jin Jae\nabout the Lost at the mines.

From this moment forward, I will take every precaution to ensure the people of Prydwen are safe, inside and outside these walls. \n\nWe will start by discovering how this disaster at the mine began. Surely someone saw something.
Friend or Foe
Knight-Regent Jin Jae suspects Minister Lochnir of evil doings. Interrogate him and discover the truth.
"There was a mysterious tablet. I have fragments."

A mysterious tablet, in the mines? Hm... These fragments appear to be Ancient in origin. I'm no expert, but I will consult the sage, Younge Geiser. \n\nIn the meantime, I need to know how the mine fell without my knowledge.
"The Foreman sent several missives."
Really? She said that? There's only one conceivable explanation for me not receiving the missives. \n\nMinister Lochnir must have been keeping such reports from reaching my desk.
"Why would he do that?"

That's a very good question. Perhaps it slipped his mind with all the preparations for Ser Gawain? I should allow him to clarify this point. \n\nWould you mind seeking him out? Then perhaps we'll all talk.
I can't think of any reasonable explanation why Lochnir would keep the Foreman's missives from me. \n\nI am anxious to hear what he has to say.

Ah! Our brave newcomer returns! I understand the Knight-Regent dispatched you to the mines. A lot to ask of a guest, but it's her prerogative. \n\nDo tell, though - I hope the situation there wasn't as dire as it sounded.
"It was, and there were several missives."
Oh yes, I am well aware. I received those missives myself. \n\nThe Foreman wanted us to send all our knights to help defend the mines, but that was, of course, impossible.
"Why was it impossible?"

With all the preparations for the return of the True Heir, we simply can't dispatch our knights everywhere they're needed. \n\nI was preparing to send a few knights, but then I was told that you had been given the task.
"The Knight-Regent wants to discuss this."

Oh, by all means, tell her I will come as soon as I finish my vital work on behalf of the True Heir. Which was proceeding apace before I was interrupted. \n\nTell her it won't be long. And thank you for your service to Prydwen.
Oh, yes! The Knight-Regent is still waiting for me to answer her summons! \n\nRest assured, I'll be there as soon as I'm done here.

You return, but without Minister Lochnir. I assume he claimed he was too busy with his preparations? \n\nPerhaps it's just as well. As Knight-Regent, it may be best if I handle matters personally going forward.
The Knight-Regent seems to think very highly of you, as do I. \n\nYou have the makings of a great knight. Why, you could be the first one knighted by the new king!

While you were away, Foreman Musa visited and related the whole story from the mines. \n\nShe says the day after the mysterious tablet appeared, Lost Pirates attacked the mines, seemingly out of nowhere.
Knight in the North
Knight-Regent Jin Jae is beginning to trust you. She's asked you to support Ser Payne Bennett's war efforts at Brysedd Shore.
"Yes, I fought them myself."

These pirates could only have come from the Brysedd Shore to the north. There was a den of brigands there, and now they are apparently Lost. \n\nThis seems to be an alarming trend, and we must find the source of it.
"I can investigate the pirates."
I have already dispatched Ser Payne to the north, which is my duty as Knight-Regent. \n\nLochnir will not be pleased, but perhaps he will now deign to pay me a visit.
"I can go and join Ser Payne."
You are eager and courageous, and it is most welcome. \n\nMy hope is that you and Ser Payne can deter the pirates from further incursions and discover what drives them. May fortune go with you both.
Look for Ser Payne and his squire at Brysedd Shore. I have a sense they will need your support.
I finally had the opportunity to have a conversation with Lochnir. \n\nAs much as I respect the man's legacy here in Prydwen, his explanations are not satisfactory.
How is Ser Payne doing? He is one of our most trusted knights. \n\nHe's also a seasoned soldier. Did you manage to rout the pirates together?

Good of you to join us, my valiant friend! I heard about your heroics at the mine. You definitely have the makings of a knight! \n\nFor now, we are simply grateful to have your support. Not quite a full contingent here, I'm afraid.
"How can I help?"

Before you do anything else, you must build yourself a campsite. It's the wise move when we're this far from Prydwen. \n\nThere's a splendid spot nearby. Set your tent, relax a bit if you like, we'll be here!
Making a camp should be simple. You just need a spot and a few materials. \n\nYou can collect materials from around here. You don't have to look too far.

Ah, you're back! I'm at a bit of a loss here. A few months ago, this barren beach had nothing but a smattering of pirates. \n\nNow it appears to be a war camp, with more pirates and supplies arriving by the minute.
"We need a plan of attack."
Indeed. It’s going to take an army to drive them out, and we currently lack an army. \n\nPerhaps we should pursue a more honorable approach to resolving this conflict.
You've made your first camp.\nFind out what to do next from Ser Payne.

You two stay here and defend our position. I will go forth and challenge the leader of the pirates to a duel. \n\nWhen I am victorious, I will demand that they withdraw from these shores forthwith, never to return!
Brigands on the Beach
Ser Payne has asked you to use unusual methods to fight the filthy Lost pirates. Cut off their supplies and set their boats adrift!
"You think they'll honor that?"
Oh, well, yes, good point. I suppose then we have a more limited set of options. \n\nI'm afraid I'm not much of a strategist in a scenario like this. What do you think would be most prudent?
"We start with the supply lines."

That's a grand idea! They've been unloading cargo using the smaller rowboats. \n\nIf you can destroy the anchors and set the boats adrift, that would slow them down. I'll stay and keep an eye out for their leader.
Set their rowboats adrift and we'll at least strike a blow to their supply lines. \n\nHonor and duty, my friend, honor and duty!

Bravo, my bold friend! I feared the pirates would overwhelm you, but it seems you are nigh unstoppable. \n\nWith their supplies cut off and boats adrift, their ability to wage war will be severely diminished.
You've weakened the Pirate forces.\nGive the good news to Ser Payne.

Selling goods at market may be enough for some folks, but it’s too slow for me. \n\nI loosened lips at the tavern until I heard about these pirates. Then I came for the loot. Tell this suspicious sod, that's the only reason I'm here.
Believe it or not, while you were battling on the beach, we apprehended an enemy spy! \n\nWe all saw Miss O'Malley in Prydwen, and now we caught her skulking out of the pirates' lair.
A Pirate's Plan
Grace O'Malley knows what's summoning the Lost. Go into the Pirates' den and destroy the evil artifact.
"She's not a spy. She's on our side."

string.speaker: Ser Payne Bennett
string.name: SerPayneBennett
string.quest_id: Well then, perhaps her information can be of some use after all. \n\nYou should speak with her. After all, you are the strategist here. I will focus on defending this position.

resources.string: She insisted she was here scouting the place for her own ends. \n\nI find that extremely hard to believe. Look at her, looking all suspicious. But I suppose if you're willing to vouch for her, we should at least hear what she has to say.
I've watched these rotters, I know what's driving them, making them go mad. \n\nIf this sod didn't have his head up his arse, I could've already told you everything you need to know.
"Grace, what did you see?"

I'll tell ya, but if you go in, I'm expecting some loot. \n\nThere's some kind of altar in there, glowing like a beacon. The bastards are drawn to it like flies to a carcass. I'd wager they'll wander off if you smash the damn thing.
Charging into the pirates' compound could very well be a foolhardy notion. \n\nI trust your judgment, however.
Well now, look who made it in and out of the pirates' den safely! I knew you could do it, unlike this sod. \n\nTell me, did you find that glowing altar?
“Found it and destroyed it.”

See there, we make a good team! I go in first, all sneaky like, and get the lay of the land. Then you follow up with force, taking care of business. \n\nOf course, for a partnership, it's vital all parties profit in a venture…
"Don't worry, I got your loot, right here."

Now that's a right decent friend! This'll get me a bit closer to securing my ship! \n\nSer "Pain-in-my-Arse" here tells me the Knight-Regent might be hiring new scouts as well, so I'll be heading back to Prydwen. See you there!
No surprise there. Miss O'Malley gets what she wants and disappears. \n\nI do hope your courage accomplished more than padding her coin purse.
Talk to Knight Payne.
n/a
I can only imagine the filth you had to wade through to reach the heart of the pirates' den. \n\nDid you find the foul sorcery Miss O'Malley claimed was there?
Knight's Vigil
Ser Payne Bennett has asked you to use the Spirit Shrine to get to Prydwen quickly and warn the Regent about the Lost Pirates.
"Yes, it was calling the Lost."
Interesting. Perhaps that's why we're seeing even fewer of the scoundrels coming ashore than before. \n\nThis revelation should be taken back to the Knight-Regent with all haste!
"Alright. Let's go then."

I must keep vigil here, ensure these scoundrels don't attempt any further incursions to the south. \n\nYou must go alone, and go quickly! Use the Spirit Shrine to return to Prydwen. It's a bit jarring, but time is of the essence!
I’ll stay here to contain these foul brigands. \n\nYou take word to the Knight-Regent. Good fortune to you, my stalwart friend!
I am pleased to report these filthy blackguards have been far less organized since you destroyed the altar. \n\nStill, a Knight of Prydwen remains vigilant, always!

It is most excellent to see you return in good health. You are one of the few I can trust in these strange times. \n\nYour… enterprising friend Grace left just moments ago. She said some foul altar was rallying the pirates?
"Yes, but it has been destroyed."

I think it is natural to assume this strange altar was somehow related to the tablet you found at Hiraeth Peak. \n\nMy sage, Younge Geiser, has been studying the fragments you brought back. He believes they are Ancient in origin.
Talk to Regent Jae Jin.

You have been here a short time, but perhaps you have seen the ruins yourself. \n\nThough humans have inhabited this island for thousands of years, there was a mysterious Ancient Civilization here even before we arrived.
Younge understands the Ancient language better than scholars ten times his age. \n\nI'd take his advice and inspect Khalladan and Antares.
A Matter of Discretion
Regent Jin Jae has asked you to follow up on Younge Geiser's findings about the tablet and the altar. He's her resident expert on the Ancients.
"Is that where the Lost came from?"
Many have sought answers to such questions, but few can claim to have reliable knowledge. \n\nOne thing I do know however, is that the Lost usually stay away from the ruins of the Ancients.
"But this magic clearly affects them."

It certainly appears that way, though Sage Geiser insists this tablet was not buried at the mine, but rather planted there. \n\nYou should converse with the sage yourself. This new information may yield new insights.
"I'll go right away."
Please exercise discretion in speaking of these matters around town. \n\nThe people are excited about the Heir's return; I would not dampen their spirits.
Ah… hello! Wish I had more time to talk. \n\nBut I’ve got new scrolls to study. Must get to it.

Yours is a face I've not seen before... Aha! You're the newcomer who recovered these fragments from the mine! \n\nI am very excited to speak with you! This material is definitely Ancient! Was there more in the pirate den to the north?
"There was an altar."

An altar? Related to this tablet, then? Fascinating! It couldn't have been there for long. \n\nThere's only one possibility - all of this came from the Ancient ruins of Khalladan and Antares in the eastern wood.
"We should investigate the ruins."

Yes!! Only, Minister Lochnir forbade me from going there. It's very dangerous, of course. \n\nBut you! Yes, you can go! Start with Khalladan, look for anything recently disturbed. Oh, and don't tell Lochnir!
I can't imagine how the tablet and the altar were affecting the Lost. \n\nBut if there are answers, they'll come from those ruins!
Well, if it isn't the Knight-Regent's new page! On an errand even now, I presume. \n\nI am curious, what merits such urgent attention when Jae's duty as regent so soon draws to an end?
"She asked I not speak of it around town."

Hmm... the Knight-Regent should not be conducting affairs she can't reveal to her people, wouldn't you agree? \n\nI've served as Prydwen's Minister since before her birth. I should be informed of this matter.
"This seems to make you nervous."

You presume much, page. I simply wish to convey any pressing matters to the True Heir when he arrives. \n\nKeep your secrets, but know this - Prydwen will be united as never before to honor the royal bloodline. Nothing else matters.
We have awaited this day for centuries, and our patience will be rewarded. \n\nAll of Prydwen will bask in the glory of the bloodline restored! It is our destiny!

These altars in Khalladan, seem to have some power over the Lost. “Power” might be the wrong word. But definitely some kind of influence. 

I can use Younge Geiser’s notes to figure out how to channel their essence. And if I can’t tap into their magic, maybe I can convey them to where they’ll be most useful. 

I must think this plan through to support my True King in the way he deserves. Only then, can I join him.

The Ancients clearly had ways of controlling the Guardians. I wonder if it’s the same magic that powers the altars. 

I found runes here that light up when the Lost come near them. Maybe there are more objects like these within the nearby ruins of Antares, so I shall continue my search there. 

For the True Heir and the restoration of Prydwen's glory, we will find a way to unite behind the royal bloodline once again.
Hey! Something just occurred to me… about this island and how we might get off it. \n\nGive me a little space here! I need a minute to think!
There you are! I started to venture into those ruins after you, but I lost my nerve when I caught sight of those Guardians. \n\nI hope you found something in there to make it worth your while.
"Are you looking for loot again?"

Ha! I'd wager it'll be the first and last time you hear Grace O'Malley say this, but just now, I'm on official business. \n\nThe Knight-Regent sent me to track you down. She says we need your help figuring out what's going on.
Talk to Grace O'Malley.

Just after you left Prydwen, that wide-eyed Minister Lochnir started acting strange, shouting around town that the True Heir's arrival was upon us. \n\nHe led some knights and even some townsfolk down south to "welcome the new king!"
Minister Lochnir's Mission
Grace witnessed Lochnir rallying the townsfolk of Prydwen to head south and welcome the True Heir. Answers to his true motives lie somewhere in these ruins.
"He's planning something bad."

I'd say there's no doubt about that! I tailed the bastard and his entourage. They marched straight into a crowd of the Lost. \n\nThe Knight-Regent says Lochnir's gone mad. She wants you to come help as soon as you're done here.
"I need to search the ruins of Antares first."

Then I suppose I'll be waiting for you. The Knight-Regent told me not to return without you. \n\nGet on with whatever you're doing, and if you find any treasure in the ruins, don't forget your dear friend Grace.
Whatever that Minister Lochnir's up to, it's right scary. \n\nI'd say let's finish our work here as quick as we can and get going.

The legends are true! I just needed to replicate that stone tablet. 

I had to bind and kill the poor young squire nearly a dozen times before he finally surrendered his soul, but after he fell... he was easy to control. He will walk wherever this tablet is placed. 

And this sphere, a tiny thing with tremendous power! Having this power in the palm of my hand will be an immense boon to my goal. I will make myself a staff from it, a fitting accessory for the right hand of the True King.
Well, you were gone long enough, I was starting to worry you'd fallen to those Guardians. \n\nDid you find anything else in there relating to the Minister's plans?
"Yes, he's controlling the Lost."
Well, I'll be damned if that doesn't explain a lot of the strange happenings around here. \n\nI suppose that's how he's able to walk freely among the those blue-eyed rotters as well.
Talk to Grace O'Malley.

With that revelation, I'd say it's all the more urgent that you catch up with the Knight-Regent. \n\nShe wants you to meet her at the last of the farms that hasn't fallen to the Lost. It's not too far from here.
The True Threat
Grace O'Malley has asked you to share the truth about Lochnir with the Knight-Regent at Preiddeu Farms.
"She left the town unprotected?"

She left Ser Payne in charge of Prydwen's defenses. She wanted to see to these troubles personally. \n\nI suspect the Knight-Regent's looking to draw steel against Lochnir herself. You best get going.
"Aren't you coming too?"
The Knight-Regent asked me to circle down to the pirate dens further south, see what's happening there. \n\nI'll catch up with you at that farm soon enough.
Keep your eyes on the horizon, my friend, and always stay upwind of your enemies.
I’ll be heading down to look over the pirate camps to the south. \n\nI’m sure we’ll meet again soon. Watch your back until then.
I cannot express how reassuring it is to have your presence down here. \n\nAs much respect as I've always had for Minister Lochnir, it is painfully clear that he's suddenly gone quite mad.
"He's been planning this for a while."
Is that what you discovered in the ruins? Was Lochnir behind the strange tablet at the mine? The pirates, too? \n\nI am having trouble understanding what his ultimate goal is, or if he even has one.
"Could this be related to the True Heir?"

I question everything the Minister said now, but apparently the Knights at Teyrnon Keep met Ser Gawain. \n\nPercilla here was a knight there herself, until recently. I believe she's hiding something. You should speak to her.
"What are your plans for Lochnir?"
I fear what Lochnir's ultimate intentions could be. \n\nI probably should return to Prydwen to bolster the town's defenses.
Have you encountered Minister Lochnir yet? \n\nMy sources suspect he may have turned into one of the Lost himself.
Well met, stranger. The Knight-Regent said you have been her only reliable counsel in recent days. \n\nFor your service to her, and to Prydwen, I salute you. I was a knight myself, not long ago.
"And now you're farming?"

Um… yes. When the farms in these parts started falling to the Lost, the town's supplies were threatened. \n\nI... volunteered to take over this farm to ensure Prydwen did not go hungry. It was… a difficult decision.
Talk to Percilla Wallen.
I will defend this farm with everything I have. It shall not fall to the Lost. \n\nWe will support Prydwen until the bitter end.
It was not long after I left Teyrnon Keep that my fellow knights there… fell to becoming Lost as well. \n\nIf I overheard correctly, you found proof that Lochnir planned all of this?
Heavy Lies the Crown
Percilla Wallen suspects it's already too late, but you could try to recover the Circlet Of Swords from Teyrnon Keep.
"Yes, he can control the Lost."

That… explains much. I know the Minister had planned to claim the Circlet of Swords, the royal crown of Monarch's Bluffs, from Teyrnon Keep. \n\nIf he can control the Lost Knights there, I suppose that's how he'll do it.
"We should try to stop him."

I suspect it’s already too late, and my fellow knights still defend the Keep as firmly as ever. \n\nI’d advise against going - there's nothing there but death and grief. But… perhaps you may discover more of Lochnir's plan.
"You should join me."

No, I will not raise my blade against my fellow knights, even in the state they're in. \n\nI will give you this seal, however. You'll also need the seals of the other knights to access the sacred chamber inside the Keep.
Again, I would urge you to reconsider this course of action. \n\nMy fellow knights are formidable combatants. Getting their seals will be difficult.

The knights are loyal to the True Heir. He was after all, Artorius’ most trusted knight and nephew, the one who the High King himself put in charge of the circle. 

Ser Gawain looks to me, now, trusting me with his power. He commands me without words. 

Our path is set. He will be crowned with the Circlet of Swords, and watch as the Lost multiply and submit to his glory.
Celliwig Ghof Sanctum Door

You ventured into Teyrnon Keep and returned with your soul intact? You are indeed as worthy as the Knight-Regent claimed. \n\nI trust you discovered that Lochnir had already taken the crown? I suspected as much.
"How did he get in without your seal?"
He… oh, God's blood! I cannot bear the burden of this dark secret any more! \n\nI was there, and I witnessed when Lochnir brought Ser Gawain for us to swear loyalty!
Talk to Percilla Wallen.

The Minister told us we would be honored to be the first to kneel before the new king. \n\nBut when he ushered Ser Gawain into the Keep, we realized… the True Heir was Lost himself! We were aghast, speechless.
Southern Scout
Percilla Wallen has advised you meet Grace and stay informed of her latest findings at Deadman's Shrine.
"What happened?"

The Minister reminded us of our sworn duty to the royal bloodline. He told us the sacrifice of becoming Lost was noble and right. \n\nThen he lined us up, and killed us one-by one. I… faltered. I couldn't do it, so I... fled.
"Of course. That wasn't noble, it was madness."

I was ashamed, unwilling to join them in soullessness, but also unwilling to betray my comrades and the bloodline. \n\nI regret it now… I should've come to the Knight-Regent sooner. Perhaps I could've prevented all this…
"It's not too late. Join me."

I… alright, it is my duty. The Knight-Regent has returned to Prydwen, but we can try to stop Lochnir down here. \n\nA scout was sent southward, you should seek them out. Once I dig up my armor, I will join you. And friend… thank you.
I believe the Knight-Regent said this new scout was a recent arrival, like yourself. \n\nI think her name was Grace.
I was so ashamed of abandoning my duties that I buried my armor. \n\nI shall dig it up and join you. I hope this will restore some measure of my honor…

Thank goodness I found someone I can report to! And better it's not the Knight-Regent. \n\nRemember all those Lost pirates swarming around that den to the north? That was a small affair compared to this place.
"What did you learn?"
Good old Minister Lochnir was here sure enough. There's another one of those glowing altars. \n\nBut this time, I don't think he's meaning to draw the pirates in, but rather send them forth.
Talk to Grace O'Malley.
The rotten bastards are loading up their ships with explosives as we speak. \n\nI'd wager they're sailing for Prydwen as soon as he gives word. They'll blast the town from here to Galway!
The Plot against Prydwen
Stop the Lost fleet from leaving Scallywag Bay. Start with their explosives and then destroy their altar.
"We have to stop them."

Well, we've discussed this partnership before, haven't we? I get the lay of the land, and you do the battling part. \n\nYou'll be facing long odds, but you're like a lucky anchor. I'd consider making a wager on you, regardless.
"Thanks, Grace. I appreciate the confidence."
Not a problem, I'll always tell it to you straight. \n\nI'd suggest you destroy as many explosives as you can and take out that glowing altar too. Now, what would you have me do?
"Go warn Prydwen, just in case."

Now there's an order I don't mind following. I could use a cup of mead after all this crawling around. \n\nI'll go and tell the Knight-Regent what's what, but my hopes go with you. It's better if these bastards never set sail.
I'll be heading north, and I hope you'll follow soon. \n\nI look forward to hearing your stories at the Prydwen tavern.
Word is there's another town to the north where they're filthy with treasure. \n\nI think I'll be heading that way, once everything here's in order.

So she spoke the truth after all? That Grace character told me you'd gone in there on your own, but I had to see it to believe it. \n\nI heard the ruckus and saw the smoke. Am I to assume that means your mission was a success?
"Indeed. They will not be attacking Prydwen."

Well, there's cause for celebration! It's even tempting to take the good news to Prydwen right away. \n\nBut I believe there's an opportunity to strike a critical blow against the enemy, here and now.
Talk to Percilla Wallen.

Ser Gawain and his court of Lost Knights are not far. They're fortified in his ancestral home across the water, Corbenic Castle. \n\nI suspect that's where Lochnir has led his unfortunate followers, as well.
Knight to Castle
Percilla Wallen suspects Ser Gawain, the True Heir and Lochnir, the scheming minister, have gone to Corbenic Castle. Meet her there.
"We should go then."

Yes, though we need a plan. They have the Circlet of Swords and an army of Lost has already fallen under Ser Gawain's influence. \n\nDefeating a knight of legend will be hard enough, but won't he just return to command them again?
"We need to destroy Lochnir's staff."
Is that how that craven madman controls the Lost? Yes, it makes sense now. \n\nI thought perhaps it was Gawain's royal blood, but now I see, this whole thing is a contrivance of Lochnir's.
"Let's go and put an end to it."

Yes, let's do just that. I will mark the spot on your map where we can set up a defensive position and plan our attack. \n\nI will meet you there, and if the hand of justice is with us, we will prevail.
Meet me at Corbenic Castle. \n\nWe'll put an end to all this madness!
Well, here we are. This is the moment of truth. \n\nIf we fail here, the Lost will overrun Prydwen and everyone in it.
Talk to Percilla Wallen.
I don’t know what defenses this tower possesses, but it is clearly well-fortified, and Lochnir has undoubtedly taken precautions. \n\nI would expect heavy resistance.
Lost Legacy
The time of judgement is nigh. Confront Ser Gawain, the True Heir and the pestilent Minister Lochnir at Corbenic Castle.
"Alright. Let's strike now."

Your courage is unquestionable, and I've witnessed your prowess in battle. You're a force to be reckoned with. \n\nBut if I'm being honest, I'd prefer not to take up arms against my former comrades nor the heir of Artorius.
"I understand. You don't have to come."

Thank you. I will defend this position to ensure none come to the castle's defense and that Lochnir does not escape. \n\nDefeat those villains, destroy that damn staff, and reclaim the crown. I look forward to your triumphant return!
Do what must be done. \n\nYou're the only one who can stop them!
I think I've been holding my breath since you departed, or at least it feels that way. \n\nTell me, did you defeat Ser Gawain and destroy Lochnir's infernal staff?
"Yes, and I recovered the Circlet of Swords."

Praise to whatever gods are at your back! I feel like I'm waking from a long nightmare. \n\nMy thrill at learning of the True Heir's return was only matched by the horror of learning what he had become.
Talk to Percilla Wallen.

After this, perhaps we should consider abandoning this obsession with restoring the royal bloodline. \n\nWe can't return the Circlet of Swords to Teyrnon Keep, anyhow. I think we should return it to Prydwen.
A True Leader
Ser Gawain and Lochnir have been vanquished! In the absence of the True Heir, find a True Ruler for the crown.
"The Knight-Regent should have it."

Yes, though Jae is bound by her duty. She'd make an excellent queen but she can't even imagine such a thing. \n\nI suspect the court training of her youth is to blame. Her humility will be yet another formidable foe.
“We’ll have to convince her.”
Yes. We’ll speak to the people. We’ll tell them the truth about Lochnir and the heir. \n\nThe crown deserves to be worn by a noble ruler, a ruler like Jin Jae. I'll see you in Prydwen, comrade.
Now that we have the Circlet of Swords, we need to convince Jin Jae to take the mantle of leadership.\n\nHopefully, she'll accept the crown.
The new Queen will need a knight. \n\nI plan to stay by her side as long as she will have me.
Word of your victory has already breached the walls, and we are extremely grateful. \n\nI welcome you back to Prydwen as a hero. I can never repay the debt this town owes to you.
"You could accept the crown."
I… am not sure. I do not have royal blood… but I suppose we've learned that the bloodline is now cursed. \n\nStrangely enough, your friend Grace suggested the same thing just before she left.
"Where did Grace go?"
We were in the tavern after word of your success, and someone mentioned a ship builder in Oxboro. \n\nShe was so eager to meet this person, she left right away. She did ask me to tell you, of course.
Talk to Regent Jae Jin.

I would understand if you wished to follow and seek adventure to the north yourself. \n\nOtherwise, I do have Ser Payne and Ser Percilla, but I could always use more knights. Especially if I am to become queen.
Wilderness Wiseman
Meet Yonas, the fisherman at the east river. Maybe he has the answers to the voices inside your head.
"So you will accept the crown?"

Yes, after careful consideration, I realize it is the honorable thing. It is the ultimate requirement of my sworn duty. \n\nWill you stay then and serve Prydwen at my side? Or do voices call you elsewhere?
"I hear a voice, but it's Corruption."

You hear the voice of Corruption? There are legends of its insidious torment. You must be bearing such a burden! \n\nIn the days of Artorius, they say it was the voice of Myrddin that called knights to darkness. It drove them mad.
"Is there any way to fight it?"

I know of no cure, but there's an old man who comes to Prydwen now and then. He warns about Corruption. \n\nSome say he's deranged, but I see wisdom in his eyes. He fishes the east river. You should seek him out.
If anyone can help you, it would be that old man. \n\nHe's often fishing on the river to the east. Look for him there.
Now that I hear about this Corrupted voice in your head, the Watcher's Report is even more disturbing. \n\nI fear Gawain and Lochnir were a prelude to an even greater threat that now approaches.
Talk to Yonas.
[Yonas's lines are in 99A_Objectives.loc. The data sheet points there.]
Welcome to the Bluffs, take rest. Please make this your home. \n\nThis blighted land will soon be blessed, when the True Heir takes the throne.
Come, Seeker, danger abounds, but your fortune will be grown. \n\nThe Lost banished, peace found, when the True Heir takes the throne.
The True Heir sought to save us once, and now, the answer they’ll bring. \n\nThe Lost will learn, be forever turned. They’ll know them as Our One True King!
Flowers for the Heir
The True Heir is returning to Monarch's Bluffs! Fiona Murphy has asked you to bring Avalon Lilies to Pendragon Landing as a tribute.
“They sound important.”
Mountain and dale speak the tale, a warrior of wit and renown. \n\nArtorius raised them strong and brave, a True Heir for his crown.
“How do we welcome them?”
For the Heir, bring flowers fair, that we may build a path of blooms. \n\nMay they know their people care, it is them we choose.
No tribute too large, no deed too small, when the fated ship comes home. \n\nLay down a carpet of flowers, all, for when the True Heir takes the throne.
The True Heir sought to save us once, and now, the answer they’ll bring. \n\nThe Lost will learn, be forever turned. They’ll know them as Our One True King!
Talk to Fiona Murphy.
Have you ever held the song of love in your heart? \n\nIt’s hard to keep your spirits up on the island. But a darling sweeting can make any place feel like home!
Love keeps you warm, but so does wool. Come to me, if you ever need something stitched. \n\nI've made a fair garment for many a fine folk. Even my darling Eddie, who isn’t back yet!
Eddie made life here bearable, you know. \n\nWithout him… What am I thinking? You don’t have the time to listen to my woes.
The Anniversary Gift
Edda Koning wants you to remind her husband, Eddie Koning it's their anniversary. Carry the message to Cynefin Mine.
“Were you expecting him?”

Yes, my foolish heart can't help long for my Eddie. He toils too hard in the mines. \n\nThis is the first time he’s missed our anniversary! I’d go to the mines myself but his favorite turkey is roasting away.
“I’ll go look for him!”

That’d be lovely! Tell that oaf he has a wife who loves him more than the mines do. \n\nAnd then, gently remind him that it’s our anniversary today. And I’ll be very cross if he doesn’t have a gift for me.
Did you find my Eddie yet? \n\nAsk him to stop working and get here quickly!

Oh dear, he’s not with you. That can only mean… He wrote a letter? He hates writing! \n\nBlast that domkop! He loves me so much. I-I- told him to stay with me. But, no! He had to go to the mines and pick at another rock.
“I’m sorry.”
I am sorry too. There will never be another Eddie. I remember the first time he handed me his coat in the rain. Our first… \n\nThank you for bringing me the news, even if it wasn’t what I expected.
Talk to Edda Koning.

What wall can keep out despair? Which supplies can help people keep their faith? \n\nI know how to keep the Lost out of the settlement. I don't know how to judge which of our brethren are going to turn.

I’d help you settle in, but I’m the one who needs help right now. \n\nWe’ve not got enough resources to build defenses for Prydwen. I even made new picks some time ago, thinking we'd get a fresh supply of iron. How wrong I was!
Pick of the Mines
Prydwen is short on resources. Cemal, the Master Builder has asked you to retrieve the miners' picks so that he may melt them into iron.
“I can retrieve the picks.”
Would you? That would be a big help! \n\nYou can tell Foreman Allya I'll get her more picks, and better ones too, once more iron comes in.
Did you get all the miners' picks? \n\nWe need all the iron we can get!
…8, 9, 10. The miners' picks are all here, all accounted for and in good condition. \n\nThis will be a big aid to building our defenses. How can I thank you for this?
“It was nothing really.”
Hah. You have my friendship, rajal sadaq. And my time. And an odd job if you ever have need of one. \n\nWe are always on the lookout for honest, hardworking people. And you strike me as being one.
Talk to Cemal Qadir.
Did the pesky pirates give you trouble when you first arrived on these shores? \n\nSomeone has got to stop these bearded meanies! And that someone is me!
Have you ever met such coordinated pirates? It’s like they went to school or something. \n\nHow will people ever find their way to Prydwen, if they can’t even survive this beach?
Destroyer-of-Pirates, you've earned my gratitude! \n\nLet's keep protecting those who newly arrive here and one day, we may be made knights for our efforts!
Blow 'Em Down!
Squire Ashe needs your help to blow up a bunch of pirates at Brysedd Shore.
“When did you come to the island?”
I was a baby. And an absolute terror. Folks here say I used to leap out from behind trees and startle them. \n\nMy bag had a fleur-de-lis. And I spoke a little French back then.
“A fleur-de-lis? You sound royal.”
Royal? Hah! Hardly. I just want to make these pirates cry for their mothers. \n\nIf only they didn’t have so many weapons and barrels of gunpowder…
“We can use their barrels against them.”

Hah! What a good way to turn the barrels on them! Sneak up on the pirates, light their barrels, and then BOOM! Pirates blown to pieces! \n\nI’ll keep watch here and make sure no one foils our grand plan!
What are you waiting for? \n\nBlow up the pirates, already!
Hah! That was magnifique! You’re handy with gunpowder barrels! \n\nSer Payne said he might even make you a squire!
“Is that how you became a squire?”
Oui! Ser Payne sees the spark of a knight in me. I have to train more. And fight more. And impress the Regent... \n\nBut, you’ll see! I’ll become a knight soon! Then everyone will call me Ser Ashe!
Talk to Squire Ashe.
Oh, I'm a sad man who has made many a poor decision, like deciding to come here. \n\nThe island has ripped out my heart and fed her to the Lost, while I was sleeping.

Did you venture forth for freedom or fame? I came here to live happily with my sweetheart, a Moorish woman. \n\nWe both fled from impending execution for our forbidden love. Who knew I’d one day crave death like water in the desert?
Fatimah will be delighted with this mirror. I can sense a bit of magic in it already. \n\nI wonder why she was so insistent I put it together. Maybe, I'll find out soon.
A Wife's Mirror
A wistful Hugo Molina has asked you to help him find the missing fragments of his Lost wife's mirror.
“Is eternal life that bad?”

It is when you’re the reason your woman is no more. Even the moon burns you. Fatimah’s soul gave up on me. \n\nShe came to me in a dream the other day and asked me to piece together this mirror. But I don’t have all the fragments.
“I’ll help you find them.”

Would you? Fatimah said if I piece this mirror for her, she'll finally find peace, the peace I stole from her. \n\nWe were so happy once, but all the sacrifices we made... Have you ever been with someone and yet felt so alone?
Did you have any luck with the missing fragments of Fatimah's mirror? \n\nShe hasn't asked for much and I wish to give it to her, if I possibly can.

Gracias, kind soul! Fatimah always loved her mirrors. With this last fragment, she can have her final one. \n\nShe said mirrors have a certain magic to them. And I can sense the energy in this, almost a strange calling…
Talk to Hugo Molina
Have you ever observed the Lost? They look sad but they could be secretly peaceful. \n\nImagine if the most beautiful music played inside their minds. And they just can’t tell us about it.

How does it feel to be alive, stranger? To know you cannot die? \n\nI used to dig graves in Bavaria but obviously, I couldn't do that here. I survived on scraps for a while until I devised a new livelihood.
A lot of people passed right by me before you stopped and offered me assistance. \n\nOlde Geiser will remember you for your kindness always. May you go far on the island!
An Olde Tale
Help Olde Geiser provide the families of the Lost with some peace. Collect Crystalline Tears and Glittering Stones for him to build memorials with.
“What's your new calling?”

I craft Lost memorials from Crystalline Tears, to soothe grieving families. \n\nPeace is always in demand. Many ask me for my services. But, the Crystalline Tears are over and so, the tears of people must wait.
“Anything I can do to help?”

Hmm. You look more limber than me. You may have luck with these ruins. \n\nIf you can brave the eldritch dangers and gather some Crystalline Tears for me, I’ll give you a good portion of what I got from the families.
Did the ruins reveal their secrets and shed their tears for you? \n\nNot yet? Well, may your sight be sharp and your pick be purposeful.
So many tears, such little time. You've done well by bringing these Crystalline Tears. \n\nYou will be in the thoughts of many families when they say the final prayers for their kin.
Talk to Olde Geiser.

How are you adapting to this land, traveller? Have you grown up with tales of knights or like me, is it all a bit mysterious to you? \n\nMy mother misses the Joseon court. She understood what was expected of her there.

As royal ladies, we've always been protected. We led lavish lives in the Joseon court and for a while, in Ebonscale Reach. \n\nIt's the first time we're living out in the wilds, like common folk. We're trying to adapt.
A free life is better than a royal one, traveler. \n\nThe last thing I want is a pair of shackles around these heels. Maybe one day, I'll convince my mother.
Are you betrothed to anyone? I’m struggling to convince Nabi to get married. \n\nShe mustn’t meet a horrendous fate. I wouldn’t be able to live with myself.
The Maidens Lost
Nabi has asked for evidence to prove getting married is not the answer to turning Lost. Hopefully, this will get her meddlesome marriage-minded mother off her back.
“You've always been royal?”

Yes. Once upon a time, I was even destined to be queen. But I lost my betrothed to the sea on our way to the island.\n\nMy mother hasn't given up hope I will be married one day. She fears the worst if I don't.
“What does your mother fear?”

That I'll turn into a Lost, like the ones who haunt this island, a creature with no purpose but to haunt women with better prospects. \n\nMother grew up with tales of the virgin ghost. It's hard to shake her out of her belief.
“Some of the Lost were married.”

My mother will have your ear off with all her arguments. For now, I'll surrender to the shadow of her blind belief. Unless- \n\nDo you think there's a way you could bring back artefacts to prove some Lost used to be married?

Wedding rings and love letters, hmm... So, some of the Lost used to be married once? That makes no sense. \n\nAnd you're saying that even getting married doesn't keep you from turning into one of these creatures? How disturbing!
“No, but you could make a charm.”
A talisman to ward off evil spirits? What a clever idea! Why don't you use the wedding rings? \n\nMaybe they'll influence Nabi and she’ll want to get married sooner.

Did you find any items that show some of the Lost used to be married once? \n\nMy mother spoke of a dashing young man called Elias, and while I'm sure he's delightful, I simply have no aspirations to be married!
A talisman? To protect me from evil and lower my chances of turning into a ghost? \n\nDoes this mean my mother no longer believes marrying is protection against turning into the Lost?
“She still wants you to be married.”

And my mother will always want that. \n\nIf she ever turned into a Lost, which I hope she never does, she'd follow me around with the sole purpose of getting me married. And probably scare all my suitors away!
Talk to Nabi Jeong.
Oh, hello! Haven’t died many times, have you? \n\nYou have gorgeous pearly whites. Dying spoils teeth.
Show me your smile. Your teeth are radiant. Do you use Miswak to brush them? \n\nIn the Ottoman Empire, everyone had good teeth. Here, not so much. Here, people eat whatever they get.
If you ever lose all your teeth, you know who to find. \n\nYou may lose your soul but you'll never lose your smile!
Dentistry Artistry
Hamza Killic's brain is dancing with a new idea. Collect wolf fangs so that he may bring his invention to life!
“How long have you been here?”

More days than a snail has teeth. I left to pursue my great ideas in my reckless youth. \n\nI still feel as reckless and almost as young. And if I can get enough wolf teeth, I'll finally be able to craft my invention!
“How many wolf teeth do you need?”

I already have twenty-six pearly white wolf fangs. I need six more, just like them. \n\nThey should be from robust middle-aged wolves, warriors, if you can spot them. Could you get the teeth for me? I'll be grateful!
Did you get the six wolf teeth like I asked? \n\nI’ll be able to complete my brilliant invention then. Trust me, you've never seen anything as daring as this!
You spotted the wolves well - middle-aged, strong, aggressive fighters most likely. \n\nThese are the perfect fangs. They're sparkly. They're white. They can cut through meat!
“What are you inventing with them?”

The first-of-its-kind dental weapon for the toothless elderly among us, those who have the punch but lack the bite. \n\nOne chomp from these pearly beauties will make an attacker regret their choices. Brilliant, no?
Talk to Hamza Killic.
My home has been destroyed. My father has been twisted into a monster I can't recognize. I can't even afford a place to sleep. \n\nNo one can save me. And nobody will.
I have been ruined. I can't work like I once used to. \n\nWhat good are hands when your mind is occupied by the demons that plague your dreams?
My father had his time with me and he squandered it. I have no time for his sentiments now. \n\nAt least his glassworks have fetched a good price.
Heart of Glass
A grieving Olivia Barovier has asked you to retrieve her Lost father's glassworks from Arruda Ranch.
“What demons?”

Scars. My father's mistakes wore him down till he broke. He always thought the world was better... He shattered when he saw the truth. \n\nHe lost himself in making glassworks. People came from all over the island to buy them.
"Sounds like he was talented."

He had a deep relationship with glass, knew exactly which mineral would elicit the color he desired. \n\nHis works were treasures that brought hope. But now they're lost in a house filled with horrors.
“I could get his things for you.”
Would you? I can’t step foot in that house. There, there are too many memories… \n\nIt isn't easy to be second place in your father's eyes. Please just get the glassworks, if you can.
Were you able to enter the house? \n\nDid you find my father’s glassworks?
Getting into the house must not have been easy. I am grateful for your courage. \n\nThese are the last things I have of my father. At least he got to spend his last days with his precious work.
“He expressed his feelings with these.”
He wrote me letters? I'll read his words, although I am fearful of what they may reveal. \n\nIsn't it ironic that my emotions are as fragile as his glass? At least his works have value.
Talk to Olivia Barovier.

What folly we have committed! We unleashed a most tragic magic by giving in to Fatimah's whims. \n\nWe made a talking mirror that berates me for my decisions, every minute, every hour, every day. It just doesn’t stop!
May you find what you’re looking for, friend. \n\nMay your wishes be fulfilled without ever being twisted.
Ending the Madness
Fixing the mirror for Hugo worsened matters. He needs your help breaking the large mirror at Deadman's Cove, so that he can finally let go of his Lost wife.
“Have you tried breaking it?”
I had to. Her words are still pounding in my head. \n\nI broke her heart. And now I've broken her mirror. Maybe that's why she won't stop haunting me.
“Do you have happy memories of her?”
Si! I do. Fatimah was the joy of my soul once. I left Spain, left my family because of my love for her. \n\nI loved my querida even when we fought. Even when her cloudy gray eyes turned into a storm.
“Hold the memory. Break the mirror.”
You are right. She speaks through another large mirror in the cove that's filled with pirates. \n\nI'll need your help to break it. But I must get her taunts out of my head.
Were you able to destroy the mirror or did Fatimah's voice get to you too? \n\nMy Fatimah can be quite compelling.
How is it that you can love someone and yet living with them can slowly destroy you? \n\nThis island didn’t help. But oh, Fatimah, I miss you so much.
Talk to Hugo Molina.
This island is filled with trials. So be prepared to learn who you really are. \n\nMan is like pepper — you only know him when you’ve ground him.
It was nothing short of a plague. They kept coming in droves, and it was all we could do to hold them back. \n\nI was sure faith had a role to play here, as it does in the tales back home.
It was nothing short of a plague. They kept coming in droves, and it was all we could do to hold them back. \n\nI was sure faith had a role to play here, as it does in the tales back home.
I hope you keep an open heart on this island. I fear it's too late for me. \n\nOne who has been bitten by a snake lives in fear of worms.
A Useless Hope
Dayo Musa's hopeful plan went horribly wrong. Retrieve the amulets from the Lost to put them at ease and return the amulets to him.
(Keep reading)

I tried to guide the people towards their faith, by giving them something tangible to focus on. \n\nI made sure each of them had an amulet to see them through. Like the stories of old, we’d weather this plague together.
(Keep reading)

They trusted me and I let them down. \n\nI should have gone into this with clearer eyes, and because of my failure, they have all fallen. I, Dayo Musa, must find someone strong to gather their amulets and give them proper rites…
The journals of Dayo Musa should really be discussed with him.
Hello, friend! I hope this day is treating you with kindness. \n\nWould you have time to help a fellow? Regrettably, the people I was trying to protect have turned into the Lost…
"I have your journal."

May fortune be with you! I'd come to the settlement to find help. But no one had time to listen. \n\nIt takes a special person to go out of their way to help someone else. Did you find everyone's amulets?
“I did. Here they are.”
Thank you, friend. You have put my mind at ease. \n\nThe problems on this island are larger than those I've experienced. And one can't use their hand to force the sun to set.
Talk to Dayo Musa.
I will follow the path of my ancestor, Ser Margot Dubois. \n\nI’ll become a knight worthy of her praise!

Margot Dubois the Steadfast, knighted by Artorius, seated in the fifth seat of the Round table. \n\nThe Resolved Scout, Keeper of the Scepter, Crest of the Lark, bequeathed this day on a scarf of olive silk.

Margot Dubois the Steadfast, knighted by Artorius, seated in the fifth seat of the Round table. \n\nThe Resolved Scout, Keeper of the Scepter, Crest of the Lark, bequeathed this day on a scarf of olive silk.
Knight? Who? Me?
Ashe Dubois, Ser Payne's squire, has always longed to be a knight. Give her the proof that someone in her family used to be a knight once.
(Keep reading)

The helm, the bow, and the crest of Margot will mark the Dubois family history. \n\nThrough generations, the Dubois name will be welcome in the halls of Artorius. They must be informed that they can uphold this honor.
The proclamation concerning the Dubois Family Crest should should be taken to Ashe Dubois.
Really? You found something that belonged to my family! \n\nWhat is it? Who are they? Where can I meet them?
“A Dubois lady was a famous Knight.”

Ooh! Give me that! She was a prestigious knight in the time of Artorius himself. I can’t believe it. \n\nThis knight business runs in my blood! Thank you for bringing this to me. I’m going to keep it as a reminder.
Talk to Squire Ashe.
Are you betrothed to anyone? I’m struggling to convince Nabi to get married. \n\nShe mustn’t meet a horrendous fate. I wouldn’t be able to live with myself.
I came here from the north, believing this place would be better. \n\nInstead, I found a den of snakes in the guise of chivalry.
“Someone cheat you?”

A stranger promised me shelter in exchange for information about a knight. \n\nThey did the unspeakable and didn't even live up to their promise. Everyone’s going to turn Lost soon and there’s nothing anyone can do about it.
I knew there was a great elsewhere out there, where chivalry hadn’t died an untimely death. \n\nI found it! Here, I can put my ignoble past behind me and take up the glorious burdens of knighthood!
“So you've always wanted to be a knight?”

It's been my lifelong dream! Being a knight in a mystical land full of monsters and magic! \n\nI’m going to look for some exotic flowers soon. Then I can gift them to a fair maiden and fight in her name!
My peers are probably having a good time fishing somewhere on the island, sharing tales of the Old World. \n\nMeanwhile, I’ve barely made it out of a monster-ridden mine with my skin intact.
“Why be a miner?”
I thought it would be adventurous. I didn’t want to sit by a lake all day. \n\nWell, I’ve had my fill of monsters, funny rocks, and illusions caused by foul air. I wanted a new job! And I got one!
“What’s your new job?”
Mineworks Advisor for the Regent. She’s upset about what happened to us at the mines. \n\nShe’s going to make sure the mines are safe for all hardworking miners. And she wants my help to do it!

Thanks for rescuing us! When I was surrounded by the Lost, I remembered everyone who’d ever told me I shouldn’t venture out on my own. \n\nBeating the odds felt good. It made every decision I’ve ever made feel right in a way.
“I'm sure you feel vindicated.”

Well there's so much uncertainty when faced with the soulless. I don’t know how the Regent does it. \n\nShe's normally so good at making decisions for all of us. It puzzles me why she didn’t get to us sooner.
Do you know what happened with Allya’s messages? The Regent would have never taken that much time to send help. \n\nThe first time I came here, she called me to Court, just to make me feel welcome.
“You like the Regent?”

Who doesn’t like her? She used to visit the mines weekly before people started turning into the Lost. \n\nShe probably spends entire nights trying to figure out why this is happening. It's like the puzzle of the rocks.
“The rocks have a puzzle?”

Oh, yes! The mysteries of a land are in its dirt. How does Azoth travel? What remains of the people who lived here once? \n\nI’ll solve the mysteries of this island one mineral vein at a time. It’s a most fascinating conundrum!
What'll it be, friend? A drink to wash away your sorrows, or a drink to celebrate the gift of life? \n\nThere's always a good reason to knock one back, if you ask me.
Hey, are you the one I've been hearing about? \n\nYes, you must be. You match the description. People talk around here, you know.
Devil Honey
Get combs of Devil's Honey from Geertie Lother's private reserve at Hiraeth Lookout and return them to her in Prydwen.
"What do people say, exactly?"
They say you've been quite a help, and I was like, "Well, why haven't they helped me?" \n\nBut then I realized, silly Geertie, it's because you haven't asked!
"Something you need help with?"
Yes! Honey! Honey so delicious it's called "Devil's Honey." I have a special reserve up on Hiraeth Lookout. \n\nCollect my honeycombs, and I'll give you some to taste.
You’ll find the honeycombs at Hiraeth Lookout. \n\nJust wait until you taste this honey!
Aha! There's my honey! Er, I mean my honeycombs. I wasn't calling you "my honey." That would be... absurd. \n\nBut yes, this is fantastic! I'm going to whip us up some honeycakes right away.
Talk to Geertie Lother.
You did me a good turn with my "Devil's Honey." \n\nI'm thinking I might have another favor to ask, if you've got the time.
Oh yeah, I can feel the party coming on already! \n\nWe got wine and honeycakes - it's gonna be a feast!
Old World Wine
Celebrate while you still can. Collect jars of Old World wine from Brysedd Shore and share them with Geertie Lother!
"Depends on the favor."

Seeing as how everyone is talking about "battening down the hatches" here to protect against the Lost, I think we need to stock up on spirits. \n\nAnd I think I might know a spot to get our hands on some perfectly aged wine from the Old World.
"Where would this wine be?"
Brysedd Shore! Grab as many jars of wine as you can find there. \n\nWe'll celebrate a little, while we still have the time. Who knows what will happen tomorrow?
Stars above! The Old World wine from Brysedd Shore! I can't wait. \n\nPirates sure have all the best stuff!
Oh yeah, I can feel the party coming on already! \n\nWe got wine and honeycakes - it's gonna be a feast!
Talk to Geertie Lother.

Let me give you a tip, rajal sadaq. No one cares where you came from. We care about what you can do. \n\nThe Regent made me her Master Builder after she saw my work. Though she probably regrets that now…
Resources for Prydwen
Collect Stone, Wood and Leather for Cemal Qadir, Prydwen's Master Builder, so that he can build good defenses for Prydwen.
“Why would you say that?”

Well, I've run into some supply troubles. I was expecting a shipment of stone, timber, and leather this week. \n\nNothing’s turned up yet. I fear the poor souls I found to help me may have turned into the Lost.
“I can procure your resources.”
Oh! Would you? That’d be most excellent! \n\nYou’d need to cut trees to gather wood, and crush rocks to extract stone - there’s a lot to teach you. But you seem up to the task.
Did you get everything? Not one hair of leather should be missing. \n\nEvery resource counts towards fortifying Prydwen’s defenses.
Great! You brought exactly what I needed, the right type and the right amount. \n\nWere you always this resourceful?
“I've been told I can be handy.”
Haha! You’re a good person, rajal sadaq. You're going to do very well here on Aeternum. \n\nI hope to see more of you.
Talk to Cemal Qadir.
Have you made friends here? You seem like someone a person would be lucky to call a friend. \n\nBack home in Syria, we always repay favors. You’ve helped me a lot. I hope I can return the favor.
A lot of people have been telling me great things about you. \n\nI hope you know, you’ll have many friends here, if you choose to stay.
A Sword for a Friend
Cemal Qadir is very happy with the work you've done and wants to do something for you in turn. Learn how to build a sword with his guidance.
“One good turn deserves another.”
Words to live by, rajal sadaq! You could be knight material and I want to see you make it through a few more summers, at least. \n\nHas anyone taught you how to make a sword?
“Not yet.”
I suppose I must do everything around here. I'm sure that once I teach you to make a sword, you’ll be able to supply armories. \n\nYou have that industrious look about you.
Craft me the best sword you can! \n\nI want to see what you’re capable of!
That's a fine-looking sword, rajal sadaq. It would almost rival the swords in Syria. \n\nI'm not surprised. It’s what I've come to expect from you.
“I learned from the best.”
Hah! Drop by at the tavern, anytime you want a drink, alright? \n\nI'll tell you stories of the High King Artorius you wouldn’t believe!
Talk to Cemal Qadir.

Brutal Captain Esteban and his crew are attacking the shore. Send the scurvy rats scurrying back to sea.

Ladimere is assembling forces against Prydwen. Stop him and break the shrine he guards.
Summon Captain Ladimere Wright

Captain Ladimere Wright

Helvan the Navigator
The Navigator’s Stronghold
Helvan and his crew are planning to attack Prydwen. Defeat Helvan and destroy his treasured shrine.
Destroy the Ominous Altar to draw out Helvan the Navigator.
Defeat Helvan's Lackeys
Survive Helvan's Explosives
Defeat Helvan the Navigator
Helvan guards an ancient altar in Traitor's Hold. Tread carefully, for Helvan's deceptive ambushes are known far and wide, upon the seas.
Corruption will claim them all. Warning them is a futile effort. \n\nThey are blind to the real danger all around them...
Corruption will claim them all. Warning them is a futile effort.
They are blind to the real danger all around them…
You see? They are all corrupt in their own way. \n\nWhether they know it or not, they are already welcoming my embrace…
You see? They are all corrupt in their own way.
Whether they know it or not, they are already welcoming my embrace…
Look how they fall in line when they realize something greater than them is at their doorstep. \n\nIt will be the same with Corruption…
Look how they fall in line when they realize something greater than them is at their doorstep.
It will be the same with Corruption…
So, you've stopped the Lost's conquest of this kingdom. \n\nI have to wonder - are you sure you've really helped these people?
So, you've stopped the Lost's conquest of this kingdom.
I have to wonder - are you sure you've really helped these people?
Burn, you lily-livered loon!
Scamper starboard, you dirty dog!
Flee portside, you fat rat!
Ahoy, me hearty!
Hah, a short-lived victory! Soon, you will be like me.
Go near the altar, matey? Over my body.
Bilge-sucker, beware of what you do not know.
Dirty rat, destroy His altar and you will wish you could die.
You cannot stand against the true vision for these lands!
You should have rallied under the True Heir!
Enough of this! I will see you destroyed in the name of the True King!
Your attempts to harm me only lead to your own demise!
How could I have failed?
The True King will avenge me!
You will serve the True King in death!
Fool! I have the power here!
Witness the might of the Hand of the King!
Ser Gawain
Fall Of The True Heir
Ser Gawain, the True Heir, is Lost! Vanquish him and reclaim the Circlet of Swords.
Defeat Ser Gawain
Disrupt Ser Gawain's Idols
Defeat Ser Gawain
Disrupt Ser Gawain's Idols
Break Ser Gawain's Altar
Defeat Ser Gawain
I’ve returned to claim what is mine. I bear this burden for the good of all!
These lands are mine by right and decree. Who are you to stand against me?
Why do you persist? I must claim these lands to protect them! It is my right!
Your disrespect for a holy relic sickens me. I will see that you atone!
Do you hold nothing sacred? Justice will be done by my hand!
The divine power to rule and see justice done is still mine.
Am I already through the mists? Have I been damned all along?
What are you lot doing here? Come to steal what is mine? Have at you!
This isn’t the last you’ve seen of Esteban! The seas will be mine one day!
These lands are mine! I’ll see you all driven from them!
I won’t suffer no squatters on my property! Get! Get! All of you!
Vagrants trying to take what’s ours? Oh, no you won’t!
I’ll be back… with more help next time! You’ll see…
Hold on to the spark of hope within you. It will keep you safe in the darkness of despair. \n\nThe Regent is blessed and will find a way to save us all.
You're a Marauder, yes? So tell me how is Rodger…Commander Purcell? Is he in good health?
What type of fantasy are you weaving yourself today? So much focus on searching for something that is right under your nose.
Now that you have joined in our cause, you must carry the light into the world at every chance.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Have you seen the wonders around you? Look more closely and you will see the science behind them. \n\nThe island is like a school to the thirsty mind.
Ok, Marauder. The name is "Tuit", not "twit". And tell that child of a Commander that he needs to grow up.
It is you and your cult who are missing the plot. The Syndicate will reveal all in due time.
Now that you have officially joined in our enterprise, you should always seek ways to advance our interests.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Stand strong. Don't give in to the Lost. \n\nWe will overcome this together. The Regent will see to it.
Typical of the Syndicate to get in over your heads. Best learn to swim as you'll get no help from me.
I harbor you no ill will, though I feel uneasy when your Adjudicator is near. Her eyes. . .They drill right through me.
Now that you have officially joined our ranks, we expect you to seize every opportunity to gain honor.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Welcome to 'The Regent's Rise'! Sleep here and wake up feeling like a king!\n\nYou here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
I've heard the talk around town, people saying things are safer around here.\n\nNot sure I believe it. I might just pick up and head south one of these days.
You know, I'm never one to turn away a good paying customer.\n\nBut you've been here long enough - might want to look into buying a house, making this permanent.
"Why should I buy a house?"

I mean, you're always welcome here in the inn, but a house offers some amenities.\n\nYou can furnish the place, of course, and if you get yourself killed somehow, you can be resurrected right in the comfort of your own home!

Tablet Fragments
The remains of the smashed runed tablet. The stone is brittle, like a sandstone.
Helvan's Blunderbuss
This weapon seems exceptionally well-made, with treated wood and polished bronze adorning the chassis.
Altar Shard
A chunk that fell off the mysterious altar in Traitor's Hold. The altar seemed to have lost its power, but this piece still resonates with a faint energy.
Hawk's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a hawk.
Crane's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a crane.
Sparrow's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a sparrow.
Circlet of Swords
A simple but beautiful crown. It looks like it is made with pure iron with gold lining the top.
Lochnir's Staff
This staff is made from a single piece of shaped wood with some small runes etched along the side. The top of the staff appears to have been added on more recently.
Avalon Lily
A beautiful white lily with a brilliant yellow plume inside.
Keepsake Key
A small silvered key. It's slightly scuffed, as if its owner kept it with them all of the time.
Miner's Pick
This pick looks weathered and worn, but it is incredibly sturdy. The tip seems sharp in spite of the scuffs and scratches.
Mirror Shards
A sliver of a blackened mirror.
Crystalline Tear
A sparkling jewel. It needs some work to really bring out the beauty hidden inside.
Soft Gold Ring
A fairly plain golden wedding ring.
Nabi's Notes
A set of scribbled notes, signed by Nabi.
Sharp Canine
A strong wolf canine. It seems incredibly sharp.
Parchment Letters
Although written on a flimsy parchment, the words in this letter appear to be meticulously written.
Ornate Glass Sculpture
A beautiful glass ornament, carefully crafted by skilled hands.
Protective Amulet
A symbol of faith, intended to protect the bearer.
Devil's Honey
Special honey, made by bees who live up on Hiraeth Peak.
Mist Wine
Where this wine is brewed is something of a mystery, but the citizens of Prydwen consider it to be a delicacy.
The Town Project Board
Visit the Town Project Board of Monarch's Bluffs and find tasks to help the people of the settlement.
Visit the Monarch's Bluffs Town Project Board
